            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Swim Drink Fish staff have been collecting water samples for investigations, research reports, legal action, and media training since our first day back in 2001. Over the years, we’ve discovered that routine water quality monitoring at recreational sites has a special power. To know if waters are “swimmable”, you need to collect samples on a regular basis. That’s because recreational water quality is like the weather — it changes all the time. 

ake Ontario Waterkeeper began collecting water samples and testing for E. coli in 2016. E. coli is an indicator for sewage—the more E. coli present in a sample, the greater the risk to public health and the environment.

2021 is the sixth year of sampling at Toronto's Inner Harbour sites. Staff along with a group of trained citizen scientists sample the water every Tuesday and Thursday. We sample three main locations in the Inner Harbour In 2019, Ontario Place West Island Beach was also added as a site- which is one of the few accessible swimming locations in Toronto’s West End. 

In 2018 two teams of dedicated, trained citizen scientists started monitoring Humber Bay West Park in Etobicoke, and Algonquin Bridge and Snake Island on Wards Island. In 2021, First Street Beach was added as a sampling site. We have added the</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

name: 10-25976-zqwq-zh61
notes:
Swim Drink Fish staff have been collecting water samples for investigations, research reports, legal action, and media training since our first day back in 2001. Over the years, we’ve discovered that routine water quality monitoring at recreational sites has a special power. To know if waters are “swimmable”, you need to collect samples on a regular basis. That’s because recreational water quality is like the weather — it changes all the time. 

ake Ontario Waterkeeper began collecting water samples and testing for E. coli in 2016. E. coli is an indicator for sewage—the more E. coli present in a sample, the greater the risk to public health and the environment.

2021 is the sixth year of sampling at Toronto's Inner Harbour sites. Staff along with a group of trained citizen scientists sample the water every Tuesday and Thursday. We sample three main locations in the Inner Harbour In 2019, Ontario Place West Island Beach was also added as a site- which is one of the few accessible swimming locations in Toronto’s West End. 

In 2018 two teams of dedicated, trained citizen scientists started monitoring Humber Bay West Park in Etobicoke, and Algonquin Bridge and Snake Island on Wards Island. In 2021, First Street Beach was added as a sampling site. We have added the

notes_translated.en:
Swim Drink Fish staff have been collecting water samples for investigations, research reports, legal action, and media training since our first day back in 2001. Over the years, we’ve discovered that routine water quality monitoring at recreational sites has a special power. To know if waters are “swimmable”, you need to collect samples on a regular basis. That’s because recreational water quality is like the weather — it changes all the time. 

ake Ontario Waterkeeper began collecting water samples and testing for E. coli in 2016. E. coli is an indicator for sewage—the more E. coli present in a sample, the greater the risk to public health and the environment.

2021 is the sixth year of sampling at Toronto's Inner Harbour sites. Staff along with a group of trained citizen scientists sample the water every Tuesday and Thursday. We sample three main locations in the Inner Harbour In 2019, Ontario Place West Island Beach was also added as a site- which is one of the few accessible swimming locations in Toronto’s West End. 

In 2018 two teams of dedicated, trained citizen scientists started monitoring Humber Bay West Park in Etobicoke, and Algonquin Bridge and Snake Island on Wards Island. In 2021, First Street Beach was added as a sampling site. We have added the
notes_translated.fr:
Le personnel de Swim Drink Fish collecte des échantillons d'eau pour des enquêtes, des rapports de recherche, des actions en justice et des formations médiatiques depuis notre premier jour en 2001. Au fil des ans, nous avons découvert que la surveillance régulière de la qualité de l'eau sur les sites récréatifs avait un pouvoir particulier. Pour savoir si les eaux sont « baignables », vous devez prélever des échantillons régulièrement. C'est parce que la qualité de l'eau utilisée à des fins récréatives est comparable à la météo : elle change constamment. 

Lake Ontario Waterkeeper a commencé à prélever des échantillons d'eau et à effectuer des tests pour détecter la présence d'E. coli en 2016. E. coli est un indicateur des eaux usées : plus il y a d'E. coli dans un échantillon, plus le risque pour la santé publique et l'environnement est élevé.

2021 est la sixième année d'échantillonnage sur les sites du port intérieur de Toronto. Le personnel et un groupe de scientifiques citoyens qualifiés prélèvent des échantillons d'eau tous les mardis et jeudis. Nous échantillonnons trois sites principaux dans le port intérieur. En 2019, Ontario Place West Island Beach a également été ajoutée en tant que site, qui est l'un des rares lieux de baignade accessibles dans le West End de Toronto. 

En 2018, deux équipes de scientifiques citoyens dévoués et formés ont commencé à surveiller le parc Humber Bay West à Etobicoke, ainsi que le pont Algonquin et l'île Snake sur l'île Wards. En 2021, First Street Beach a été ajoutée en tant que site d'échantillonnage. Nous avons ajouté le

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
